content.description:
This route starts just to the right of the steep southeast arete, climbs up the face, and moves left around the arete to finish.

To descend, rappel from Mussy Hooks at the top of Tuxedo Junction.
content.location: To reach the start of this route, scramble up easy terrain toward the notch between the Iceberg and East Penguin.

content.description: Crux at first bolt, easier after, but the rock quality stays poor.
content.location: Located on the shorter rock just left of the West Penguin

content.description: This route has two distinct sections, starting with a 5.7 crack and finishing with a 5.7 face.
content.protection: Take a selection of small to medium pieces, up to 3 inch cams. Slings are useful, and draws to protect the bolted finish.
content.location: The Iceberg is located between the East and West Penguins. On the south face, start up a hand crack just to the left of a left-facing chimney. Climb up and left, finishing on the bolted face above.

climbs.name: Stem Cell Research
climbs.fa: Bruce Bindner, Em Holland, Dave Daly - January 2009

content.description: Climb up the south side of the West Penguin past 9 bolts to mussy hooks at the top of the formation.
Climb past two bolts to the top on quality rock. The route can also be top-roped from bolted anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolts protect this short route. Anchor bolts (but no chains or rings) are located at the top.
content.location: This route is located on a secluded, short north-facing wall just to the east of the Penguins. To reach the start, hike up over a small notch to the east of Stem Cell Research, looking to the right for a short bolted route.  Walk off from the top.

climbs.name: My Little Lab Rat
climbs.fa: Dave Daly, Bruce Bindner, Em Holland, January 2009

content.description: Starting in the gully just east of the westernmost Penguin, climb past a grainy start to better rock above.
content.location: The route is located on the indistinct, rounded  arete of the West Penguin, to the right of Stem Cell Research on the southeast corner of the tower.  Start a short ways up the gully, and follow bolts to the top. Rappel from Mussy Hooks, or continue to the top of the formation, using the last few bolts of Stem Cell Research.

content.description: This route is positioned on NE corner of the West Penguin. Scramble the corridor between the central and western Penguin to the corner. The route follows a blunt arÃªte, passing 4 bolts to a 2-bolt chained anchor.
content.location: North East corner of West Penguin. Chain anchor on top.

content.description: This is the loose and crappy slab left of "unknown 9+ ". No bolts but anchors on top.  Not really a bomb, but not very good either.
content.protection: Two bolts on top. Rap hanger bolts.
content.location: Left side of the blob left of the penguins. Easy walk up on climbers left to get to the anchors.
